kchandra423.actors

Class Actor

  • java.lang.Object
    • kchandra423.actors.Actor
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MovingActor, Obstacle, Projectile, Weapon

    public abstract class Actor
extends java.lang.Object
    An actor represents any thing that can be drawn and repeatedly acts each frame. Uses a Kimage to draw and check collisions Also has a field that determines whether or not the actor is active.
    Author:
    Kumar Chandra
    See Also:
    KImage

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Actor(KImage image)
      Creates an actor with the specified image

    • Method Detail

      • act

        public abstract void act(DrawingSurface d,
                         Room room)
        Indicates what this actor will do every frame besides drawing. Usually is just movement and checking collisions
        Parameters:
        d - The drawing surface to be acted upon
        room - The room the actor is currently in

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Returns whether this actor is currently active
        Returns:
        whether or not this actor is currently active

      • getImage

        public KImage getImage()
        Returns the Kimage representing this actor
        Returns:
        This actors Kimage

      • draw

        public void draw(DrawingSurface d)
        Draws the actor's Kimage
        Parameters:
        d - The drawing surface to be drawed onto

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(Actor other)
        Returns whether or not this actor intersects another actor by comparing their Kimage's Relatively expensive call
        Parameters:
        other - The other actor
        Returns:
        True if the two actors intersect, false otherwise

      • setActive

        public void setActive(boolean active)
        Sets this actor as active or inactive
        Parameters:
        active - The new activity of this actor
